steps_to_execute: 1. Navigate to the user profile.
2. Click the "Logout" button.
test_cases.expected_result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page.
test_cases.scenario_name: Verify successful logout from user profile.

steps_to_execute: 1. Ensure the user is logged in.
2. Click the logout option in the header.
test_cases.expected_result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page.

steps_to_execute: 1. Log in to the system.
2. Verify that the logout functionality is available and accessible from the profile or header.
3. Click the "Logout" button.
test_cases.expected_result: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page. The system no longer displays user-specific information or requires authentication.

steps_to_execute: 1. Using a performance testing tool (e.g., JMeter), simulate multiple concurrent users logging out simultaneously (e.g., 100 users).
2. Monitor the server response times for the logout requests.
test_cases.expected_result: The average logout response time should be within acceptable limits (e.g., < 2 seconds) and the server should not experience significant performance degradation or errors.

steps_to_execute: 1. Log in to the system.
2. After logout, try to access a protected resource (e.g., user profile, admin panel) by directly entering the URL in the browser.
3. Verify that the system correctly denies access.
test_cases.expected_result: The system redirects the user to the login page or displays an appropriate "access denied" message. The protected resource is not accessible.

steps_to_execute: 1. Log in to the system.
2. Perform several actions that generate data (e.g., create a post, add items to a cart).
3. Click the "Logout" button.
4. Attempt to access the account after logout.
test_cases.expected_result: User is logged out. When the same user logs back in, the data previously created is retained, and the account is in the same state as before logout.
test_cases.scenario_name: Verify data persistence and session invalidation on logout.

steps_to_execute: 1. Log in to the system.
2. Close the browser without logging out.
3. Open the browser and attempt to access protected resources (e.g., user profile).
4. Open the browser again and try to log in.
test_cases.expected_result: The system requires the user to re-enter credentials, effectively ending the previous session. Protected resources are inaccessible until a successful login.
test_cases.scenario_name: Verify session termination when the browser is closed without logging out.

user_stories.description: This user story focuses on verifying the successful logout process, including session termination, data persistence, and user redirection.
user_stories.title: Implement Logout Functionality
